channel.title: Posts on Jonas Bučinskas
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jonas Bučinskas

item.title: Kaunas Has the Audacity
item.description: A few years ago I was about an hour away from boarding a flight to New York when a stranger in front of me just plainly asked “What’s happening in Kaunas in 2022?”. Honestly, it threw me off a little until I realized I was wearing a T-Shirt with “Kaunas 2022” written all over it. After quickly gathering my thoughts, I launched into a pitch. I talked about what the European Capital of Culture is, how every year a few new cities take the title, what it means, and how Kaunas is going to be different.

item.title: Building products the right way
item.description: I love experimentation, iteration, creating proofs of concept. I, also, strongly believe that any code that is not in production is completely useless. That being said, as a person who ships software products for a living, the #1 struggle I have is launching something that is “good enough”. Product launch that is “good enough” really means that: “We just launched something that meets some baseline expectations of our potential buyers who use similar products already”.
